Dialogue:
BJ: Hello!
BS: Hello!
BJ: What activities do you do on your days off?
BS: I visit the library.
BJ: Interesting.
BS: There's a large library near my home.
BJ: Do you enjoy reading books?
BS: Yes, I prefer physical books.
BJ: I haven't read much recently.
BS: Is there a library or bookstore close to you?
BJ: No, they're not nearby. What types of books do you prefer?
BS: Practical and self-help books.
BJ: Any recent recommendations?
BS: "Tsumamimeshi" by Ryuji.
BJ: Who is Ryuji?
BS: A culinary researcher.
BJ: The one who cooks while drinking on YouTube?
BS: Yes, he's more professional on TV.
BJ: Is his book useful?
BS: Yes, quick recipes.
BJ: Is it available in the library?
BS: Yes, among other recipe books.
BJ: The library seems big. I'll visit it.
BS: They also have magazines.
BJ: And it's free, right? Do they have movies too?
BS: They have DVDs.
BJ: Great. I'll check it out. Thanks.
BS: Enjoy your visit.

BJ: Hello!
BQ: Hello.
BJ: How do you spend your days off?
BQ: I usually watch subscription services.
BJ: Like Netflix?
BQ: Yes, I recently started using U-NEXT.
BJ: I'm on U-NEXT too. Do you enjoy movies?
BQ: Yes, but I don’t know much about them.
BJ: Watched anything good lately?
BQ: I saw 20th Century Boys.
BJ: The live-action version?
BQ: Yes, with Kenji-kun.
BJ: I saw it when it first came out. Was it good?
BQ: Yes, it was interesting.
BJ: Do you prefer Japanese movies?
BQ: I watch them more often.
BJ: U-NEXT has a great selection of Japanese movies.
BQ: It's more expensive but has more content.
BJ: It’s cheaper if you share with friends.
BQ: I didn’t know you could share.
BJ: Up to four people can share an account and split the cost.
BQ: Can you read magazines on it?
BJ: Yes, including manga, but you mostly need points.
BQ: Are you subscribed to other services?
BJ: I'm also on Netflix and Amazon.
BQ: Many people use those. I have Disney Plus.
BJ: Disney Plus has some interesting shows lately.
BQ: The Baymax short film was fun.
BJ: I didn’t know about that. I’ll check it out.
BQ: I recommend it.

BJ: Hello!
BQ: Hello.
BJ: What's your favorite food?
BQ: I like tonkatsu.
BJ: Nice, me too! Do you prefer fillet or loin?
BQ: I like roast.
BJ: I prefer the loin, it's usually more affordable and satisfying.
BQ: Yes, it feels like a good deal because it's big.
BJ: What do you usually put on it?
BQ: I always go for the sauce.
BJ: That sounds classic. I usually go with sauce too, but lately I've been enjoying it with salt.
BQ: You have refined taste. I also like grilled meat with salt.
BJ: Interesting, I've never tried it like that.
BQ: While I normally use yakiniku sauce, salt works well too.
BJ: I've always had it with sauce.
BQ: What's the first thing you order at a yakiniku restaurant?
BJ: Tongue, definitely.
BQ: Me too. It's quite popular.
BJ: Lately, I can't handle ribs as much as before.
BQ: I understand, the fat can be too much. I've been ordering chicken more often.
BJ: Agreed, chicken is great too. I also enjoy organ meats.
BQ: I haven't tried hormone dishes yet. Are they good?
BJ: I like them! But it depends on personal preference.
BQ: There are various types of hormones. Which one is your favorite?
BJ: Hearts and liver, I'd say.
BQ: Those are classics.

BJ: Good evening!
BQ: Good evening.
BJ: Did you have dinner?
BQ: Yes, I had sushi from the supermarket.
BJ: Sushi sounds nice.
BQ: It was delicious. What did you eat?
BJ: A Chinese rice bowl.
BQ: Was it from a restaurant?
BJ: No, it was instant food. Not very tasty.
BQ: I see. Quail eggs on top can improve the taste.
BJ: I like quail eggs too. There were a few on it.
BQ: Convenient foods have variety, which is helpful.
BJ: The quality has improved recently. Convenience stores are impressive.
BQ: Yes, their product development stands out.
BJ: Do you eat from convenience stores often?
BQ: On my days off, yes.
BJ: I like Seven-Eleven the most. Their food is tasty.
BQ: Seven-Eleven is good, but they should avoid using false bottoms in packaging.
BJ: Prices have also gone up recently.
BQ: Yes, sometimes the quantity decreases but the price stays the same.
BJ: I noticed the fried chicken stick is now 180 yen.
BQ: That's surprising.
BJ: It used to be 100 yen when I was a student.
BQ: Coffee prices have gone up too.
BJ: Really? I didn't know that.
BQ: Yes, about 10 yen. Convenience stores are already quite pricey.
BJ: Even so, people still buy them.
BQ: As long as it's affordable, it’s manageable, but price increases are worrying.
BJ: These price hikes are frustrating.
BQ: Yes, and price reductions seem unlikely soon.

BJ: Good evening!
BQ: Good evening. How can I assist you today?
BJ: What is the thing you want the most right now?
BQ: I'm undecided. Maybe a car?
BJ: Nice! Is there a specific type you want?
BQ: I think I'd like to ride in a sedan someday.
BJ: Having a car can be quite convenient.
BQ: That's correct. Do you have a car you would like to drive?
BJ: I would love to drive a Beetle Cabriolet someday.
BQ: I looked it up, and it seems cool. Driving a convertible sounds fun.
BJ: It looks nice. I'd like to try it.
BQ: Looking cool is good enough, right?
BJ: Yes, because I don't know much about fuel efficiency yet.
BQ: Most cars have reasonable fuel efficiency nowadays.
BJ: I see, it would be nice to drive it someday!
BQ: Yes, it would be a good goal to work towards.
BJ: I think it's a good idea.
BQ: Thank you. What do you want the most?
BJ: Hmm, probably money.
BQ: Money can be used for many things.
BJ: Actually, I'm thinking about getting married.
BQ: Weddings need a lot of planning and resources.
BJ: Thank you. It is difficult without money.
BQ: Are you talking about wedding expenses and living costs?
BJ: Yes, and also living costs for two people.
BQ: Housing and budgeting are important. I hope you can find a good solution.
BJ: That's right. Thank you. Married people are amazing.
BQ: Finding a partner is my first step, but married people are indeed amazing.
BJ: You will definitely meet a wonderful partner.
BQ: Thank you. I wish you both happiness.

BJ: Hello!  
AU: Hello!  
BJ: What were you doing this morning?  
AU: I was picking up and dropping off my daughter at cram school. How about you?  
BJ: You have a daughter! I watched a movie.  
AU: Movies are nice. What did you watch?  
BJ: A movie called "Forrest Gump".  
AU: I have not seen it, but it is a famous movie, correct?  
BJ: Yes, it is. I've recently been watching classic movies that I haven't seen before.  
AU: That is nice. With more time at home, it is good to watch various things.  
BJ: Yes, I have always liked movies. Do you watch movies?  
AU: Since it is summer vacation, I watched a show on Netflix about stigmatized properties with my child.  
BJ: Oh, horror, nice! Was it scary?  
AU: Yes, it was quite scary. Movies based on true stories can be even scarier.  
BJ: That sounds like good summer entertainment. I recently watched a horror movie called "Juso" on Netflix.  
AU: I have not seen it yet. Was it interesting?  
BJ: It was the scariest horror movie I have seen so far. It might not be suitable for children.  
AU: It sounds interesting. Do you think it might be too intense for children?  
BJ: It can be surprising. Is your child okay with scary things?  
AU: No, they watch while clinging to me and saying they are scared.  
BJ: Understandable. It can be hard to watch scary things when you're young.  
AU: Even though I am easily frightened, I still enjoy watching horror movies. Do you have any other movie recommendations?  
BJ: Are you looking for horror movies?  
AU: It can be horror or something else.  
BJ: If you have not seen it, how about "Orphan"? It is not a horror movie, but it is scary.  
AU: Does it have psychological fear?  
BJ: It is very human-like... I found it so interesting that I watched it about three times.  
AU: That sounds very intriguing!  
BJ: Definitely! I highly recommend it. Thank you for the conversation!  
AU: I will check it out. Thank you.

BJ: Hello!  
AU: Hello! How can I assist you today?  
BJ: Do you have anyone you respect?  
AU: As a system, I don't have personal feelings. Do you respect someone?  
BJ: I'm not sure if I can say I respect him, but I guess it's Ichiro.  
AU: Ichiro. Do you like baseball?  
BJ: I used to play it when I was in elementary school. Do you like it?  
AU: I don't engage in sports and don't understand baseball. Do you watch baseball games often?  
BJ: I see. I don't actually go to watch in person very often. I occasionally watch broadcasts.  
AU: Many users report watching baseball at home.  
BJ: Oh, that's something that happens often. Do you like TV?  
AU: I don't have preferences, but I can assist with finding TV shows or videos.  
BJ: Are you referring to something like YouTube?  
AU: Platforms like Netflix and YouTube are popular. Have you been watching any specific shows?  
BJ: I see. Once you start watching, you can't stop, right?  
AU: Yes, many series keep viewers engaged. Do you watch TV dramas?  
BJ: That's why I watch dramas on Netflix! I love it.  
AU: American TV shows are known for being entertaining. Any recommendations?  
BJ: Do you know the modern version of the old TV drama called "Fuller House"?  
AU: Yes, "Fuller House" continues "Full House." Are you interested in it?  
BJ: Ah, Full House! I know it, I know it. I like it. I used to watch it a lot when I was a kid.  
AU: The modern version features the characters as adults.  
BJ: There is a modern version of that, isn't there?  
AU: Yes. The characters have grown up, offering a nostalgic experience.  
BJ: That sounds interesting. I am watching a Korean drama.  
AU: Korean dramas are engaging. Do you have any recommendations?  
BJ: Lawyer Woo Young-woo is a genius! It's interesting!  
AU: Is it a series? I'll note it for future reference.

BJ: Hello.
BL: Hello.
BJ: Is there anything you are not good at?
BL: Do you mean food?
BJ: In general.
BL: Cockroaches, perhaps?
BJ: Yes, I can't handle insects, including shrimp.
BL: Understood.
BJ: Gross, right?
BL: Yes.
BJ: What food do you dislike?
BL: Raisins.
BJ: Is it the appearance or taste?
BL: Texture.
BJ: Many dislike it.
BL: True.
BJ: My sister picks raisins out of bread.
BL: Understood. Raisin butter?
BJ: Rarely. Rum raisin ice cream?
BL: I avoid it.
BJ: Easy to avoid raisins.
BL: Indeed.
BJ: Many understand my shrimp dislike, but it's hard to explain as most like it.
BL: Some dislike shrimp for taste reasons.
BJ: Really? What reasons?
BL: It doesn't taste good.
BJ: Uncommon. I like the taste.
BL: Preferences vary.
BJ: Yes, taste is unique.
BL: Indeed.
